title: Healthy & Delicious: Stir-Fried Iceberg Lettuce and Sautéed Cabbage (Gomen)
summary: You can never have too many side dish recipes, so give Healthy & Delicious: Stir-Fried Iceberg Lettuce and Sautéed Cabbage (Gomen) a try. This gluten free and vegan recipe serves 4 and costs 88 cents per serving. One portion of this dish contains roughly 4g of protein, 18g of fat, and a total of 245 calories. Head to the store and pick up vegetable oil, tomatoes, garlic, and a few other things to make it today. 1 person were impressed by this recipe. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 45 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 69%. This score is solid. Try Stir Fried Chicken Wrapped with Iceberg Lettuce, Healthy & Delicious: Red Cabbage With Apples and Honey, and Cabbage Thoran (Kerala Style Stir-Fried Cabbage) for similar recipes.
instructions: Procedures                                                                              1                                                                            Combine soy sauce, sesame oil, sherry, sugar, and pepper in a bowl. Stir to mix. Set aside, but keep it close to your pan.                                                                                                                             2                                                                            Heat a large nonstick skillet over high heat, about 3 or 4 minutes, or until very hot. Add peanut oil. Immediately add garlic and half the scallions. After 5 or 10 seconds, once the garlic starts to change color, add lettuce. Saute 60 seconds, stirring every so often. Add sauce. Cook another 60 seconds, stirring so all the lettuce gets some of the sauce. Kill heat. Salt to taste. Remove to a bowl. Top with extra scallions and serve.                                                                                                                            3                                                                            Gomen (Sauteed Cabbage)                                                                                                                            4                                                                            - serves 6 -                                                                                                                            5                                                                            Adapted from Family Feasts for $75 a Week.                                                                                                                            6                                                                            Add onions to a large, dry, nonstick skillet. Heat over medium high and cook, stirring occasionally, until onions start to soften and become translucent. Add oil and drop heat to medium. Add tomatoes, garlic, and red pepper if using. Heat through, stirring often. Add cabbage. Do not stir. Cook 4 or 5 minutes.                                                                                                                            7                                                                            Okay, now stir. Then, cover and cook 20 minutes, stirring every few minutes. Cabbage will cook down. If things start to stick, add a little water.                                                                                                                             8                                                                            When cabbage is tender and shiny, kill heat. Salt to taste and serve.

steps.step: Combine soy sauce, sesame oil, sherry, sugar, and pepper in a bowl. Stir to mix. Set aside, but keep it close to your pan.
Heat a large nonstick skillet over high heat, about 3 or 4 minutes, or until very hot.
Add peanut oil. Immediately add garlic and half the scallions. After 5 or 10 seconds, once the garlic starts to change color, add lettuce.
Saute 60 seconds, stirring every so often.
Add sauce. Cook another 60 seconds, stirring so all the lettuce gets some of the sauce. Kill heat. Salt to taste.
Remove to a bowl. Top with extra scallions and serve.
Adapted from Family Feasts for $75 a Week.
Add onions to a large, dry, nonstick skillet.
Heat over medium high and cook, stirring occasionally, until onions start to soften and become translucent.
Add oil and drop heat to medium.
Add tomatoes, garlic, and red pepper if using.
Add cabbage. Do not stir. Cook 4 or 5 minutes.
Okay, now stir. Then, cover and cook 20 minutes, stirring every few minutes. Cabbage will cook down. If things start to stick, add a little water.
When cabbage is tender and shiny, kill heat. Salt to taste and serve.
